facts.fact_text: FDI disbursed in Vietnam reached USD 1.68 billion in January 2026, up 11.3% year-on-year from USD 1.51 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: Foreign direct investment (FDI) disbursed in Vietnam reached USD 1.68 billion in January 2026, up 11.3% year-on-year from USD 1.51 billion, signaling continued expansion of foreign business activities.

facts.fact_text: Total registered FDI in Vietnam fell 40.6% to USD 2.57 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: In contrast, total registered FDI fell 40.6% to USD 2.57 billion, largely due to a 67.4% decline in additional capital and a 38.6% drop in capital through share acquisitions.

facts.fact_text: Newly registered capital in Vietnam rose 15.7% to USD 1.489 billion across 349 projects.

evidences.evidence_text: Newly registered capital, however, rose 15.7% to USD 1.489 billion across 349 projects, with the number of projects increasing 23.8%.

facts.fact_text: Manufacturing and processing accounted for the largest share (76.3%) of FDI by sector in Vietnam.

evidences.evidence_text: By sector, manufacturing and processing accounted for the largest share (76.3%), followed by real estate (9.7%), information and communications (5.2%), wholesale and retail trade (4.8%), and professional activities (2.2%).

facts.fact_text: Singapore remained the largest investor in Vietnam with 41.5% of total registered capital.

evidences.evidence_text: Singapore remained the largest investor with 41.5% of total registered capital, followed by South Korea, China, and Japan.

claims.claim_text: The data reflect sustained investor confidence amid global supply chain shifts.
claims.author: Ministry of Finance

evidences.evidence_text: The Ministry of Finance said the data reflect sustained investor confidence amid global supply chain shifts.

evidence.evidence_text: Foreign direct investment (FDI) disbursed in Vietnam reached USD 1.68 billion in January 2026, up 11.3% year-on-year from USD 1.51 billion, signaling continued expansion of foreign business activities.
The Ministry of Finance said the data reflect sustained investor confidence amid global supply chain shifts.
